network
Interface Kernel

All Known Subinterfaces:
UserKernel
All Known Implementing Classes:
AbstractKernel
public interface Kernel

Logic responsible for handling routing and messaging for a single node.

A router will have a kernel decidated solely to routing, with no userspace code involved. A workstation or server will have a UserKernel, which can contain and run a Process.

Note that interfaceAdded(Interface) and such may be called before start(), in which case any operations on the passed interfaces (besides storing them) must wait for start().

Author:
Luke Maurer
See Also:
Simulator.createRouterKernel(), Simulator.createUserKernel()

Method Detail

setAddress

void setAddress(int address)
Set the address of the node. Will be called once before start().

Parameters:
address - The address assigned to this node.
See Also:
Node.address()

setName

void setName(String name)
Set the name of the node. Will be called once before start().

Parameters:
name - The name assigned to this node. Note that this is not guaranteed to be unique.
See Also:
Node.name()

setLogger

void setLogger(Logger logger)
Set the logger the node can use. Will be called once before start().

Parameters:
logger - The logger for this node to use.
See Also:
OperatingSystem.logger(), Simulator.logger(), java.util.logging

setMainThread

void setMainThread(Thread thread)
Set the thread in which start() will be run. Will be called once before start(); the thread may or not yet be running.

Parameters:
thread -

interfaceAdded

void interfaceAdded(Interface iface)
Handle a new interface. The interface will not yet be connected at the time this is called, though it may become connected immediately after.

Parameters:
iface - The new interface.

interfaceConnected

void interfaceConnected(Interface iface)
Handle the connection of an interface to another node.

Parameters:
iface - The interface that was connected. Will already have been passed to interfaceAdded(Interface).

interfaceDisconnected

void interfaceDisconnected(Interface iface)
Handle the disconnection of an interface from its peer.

Parameters:
iface - The interface that was disconnected.

start

void start()
           throws InterruptedException
Boot up the system. Will be called from a new thread.

Throws:
InterruptedException

shutDown

void shutDown()
              throws InterruptedException
Shut down the system. When this method returns, any extra threads created by the node must have stopped.

Throws:
InterruptedException
